nodes.text: Machine learning algorithms can be used to predict stock market values and thereby help investors make better buy and sell decisions
Systematic literature review (SLR) methodology was used to collect and synthesize prior research on machine learning for stock market prediction
Search process: initial corpus of 550 papers from major digital libraries (Elsevier, ACM, IEEE etc.) was screened by title, abstract, then full text, yielding 45 included papers
Inclusion criteria required English language, full text availability, and relevance to stock market prediction; quality assessment considered author contribution

Common input attributes used to train prediction models include market history, news and events, public mood, commodity prices, interest rates, foreign exchange, oil and metal rates, technical indicators, social media signals, and macroeconomic variables
Event and news information combined with other attributes increased prediction accuracy by about five percent in experiments that added event knowledge to models

Researchers have applied a range of machine learning algorithms for stock prediction: linear regression, neural networks, genetic algorithms, support vector machines, k-nearest neighbor, and random forest

Reported empirical performance from reviewed studies: random forest reported 83 percent accuracy in one study and 64 percent in another; a study with multiple classifiers achieved 65 percent accuracy; several studies report SVM outperformed other classifiers

Typical modeling procedure in reviewed studies: train algorithms on historical stock datasets (often using programming languages like Python), using selected attributes, then evaluate predictive accuracy on future or holdout data
Combining event knowledge extracted from news with neural network models has been reported by multiple researchers to improve prediction accuracy
Support vector machine (SVM) is reported in multiple studies to forecast next-day stock movements and in comparisons to perform better than several other classification methods
Stock market prediction is challenging due to dynamic price changes and the influence of many external events and macroeconomic factors
Accurate stock value prediction can help investors decide when to buy at low prices and sell at high prices, potentially increasing profit and reducing investment risk
Limitations reported or implied: prediction accuracy is sensitive to attribute selection and dataset size; improving accuracy requires more effective attributes and larger training data
Macroeconomic variables cited as influential include consumer spending, consumer investment, unemployment rate, inflation rate, and federal funds rate
